net.sourceforge.waters.model.module

Interface LabelGeometryProxy

  • All Superinterfaces:
    GeometryProxy, Proxy
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    LabelGeometryElement

    public interface LabelGeometryProxy
extends GeometryProxy

    A geometry object representing a label position.

    Labels are text boxes positioned relative to the item (node or edge) they belong to. Since the size of a text box depends on font sizes, its precise size cannot be predicted easily. To support more appealing layout on different platforms, each label geometry also has an anchor position that defines which point of the text box is defined by the offset.

    To render a label appropriately, we first have to identify the position p of the object that is labelled:

    • For nodes, p is the center of the node circle.
    • For straight edges, p is the center point of the edge.
    • For edges with a single control point, p is the position of the control point.

    Having determined position p, we add the label geometry's offset to p to obtain the position of the label box's anchor point. To position the label box, we then have to determine its size using the fonts to be used. Then the label box is positioned such that the anchor point is a the appropriate position:

    • AnchorPosition.NW - The anchor point is at the top left corner of the label box.
    • AnchorPosition.N - The anchor point is at the center of the top edge of the label box.
    • AnchorPosition.NE - The anchor point is at the top right corner of the label box.
    • AnchorPosition.W - The anchor point is at the center of the left edge of the label box.
    • AnchorPosition.C - The anchor point is at the center of the label box.
    • AnchorPosition.E - The anchor point is at the center of the right edge of the label box.
    • AnchorPosition.SW - The anchor point is at the bottom left corner of the label box.
    • AnchorPosition.S - The anchor point is at the center of the bottom edge of the label box.
    • AnchorPosition.SE - The anchor point is at the bottom right corner of the label box.
    Author:
    Robi Malik

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      AnchorPosition getAnchor()
      Gets the anchor position of this label geometry.
      Point2D getOffset()
      Gets the offset of this label geometry.

      • Methods inherited from interface net.sourceforge.waters.model.base.Proxy

        acceptVisitor, clone, getProxyInterface

    • Method Detail

      • getOffset

        Point2D getOffset()
        Gets the offset of this label geometry. The offset defines the difference of the label's anchor position with respect to the labelled item. This method returns a reference to the point object used by the geometry object, so any changes to it will immediately affect the geometry object.

      • getAnchor

        AnchorPosition getAnchor()
        Gets the anchor position of this label geometry. The anchor position defines which point of the label's text box is defined by the label position.
